@description.name: @description
@description
@description.body:
Displays an alert box. When the application is running in a PhoneGap
environment, a native alert box is shown. When debugging in a browser, a
browser alert is shown.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: title {String} The title of the alert box
@param.description: The title of the alert box

@param.name: @param
@param.body: text {String} The text to display in the alert box
@param.description: The text to display in the alert box

@param.name: @param
@param.body: handler {Function} The handler to call when the OK button was pressed
@param.description: The handler to call when the OK button was pressed

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scope {Object} The scope of the handler
@param.description: The scope of the handler

@param.name: @param
@param.body: button {String} The button title
@param.description: The button title

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.mobile.dialog.Popup|Object} a reference to an alert dialog instance. An Object, if environment is phonegap, or a {@link qx.ui.mobile.dialog.Popup} if not.
@return.description: a reference to an alert dialog instance. An Object, if environment is phonegap, or a {@link qx.ui.mobile.dialog.Popup} if not.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Displays a confirm box. When the application is running in a PhoneGap
environment, a native confirm box is shown. When debugging in a browser, a
browser confirm is shown.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: title {String} The title of the confirm box
@param.description: The title of the confirm box

@param.name: @param
@param.body: text {String} The text to display in the confirm box
@param.description: The text to display in the confirm box

@param.name: @param
@param.body: handler {Function} The handler to call when the OK button was pressed. The first parameter of the function is the index of the pressed button, starting from 0.
@param.description: The handler to call when the OK button was pressed. The first parameter of the function is the index of the pressed button, starting from 0.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scope {Object} The scope of the handler
@param.description: The scope of the handler

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
buttons {String[]} Each text entry of the array represents a button and
its title
@param.description:
Each text entry of the array represents a button and
its title

@param.name: @param
@param.body: title {String} The title of the input dialog.
@param.description: The title of the input dialog.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: text {String} The text to display in the input dialog.
@param.description: The text to display in the input dialog.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: handler {Function} The handler to call when the OK button was pressed. The first parameter of the function is the index of the pressed button, starting from 1.
@param.description: The handler to call when the OK button was pressed. The first parameter of the function is the index of the pressed button, starting from 1.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scope {Object} The scope of the handler
@param.description: The scope of the handler

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
buttons {String[]} Each text entry of the array represents a button and
its title
@param.description:
Each text entry of the array represents a button and
its title

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Displays an error dialog. When the application is running in an PhoneGap

@param.description: The title of the error dialog.

@param.name: @param

@param.description: The text to display in the error dialog.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: handler {Function} The handler to call when the OK button was pressed. The first parameter of the function is the index of the pressed button, starting from 1.
@param.description: The handler to call when the OK button was pressed. The first parameter of the function is the index of the pressed button, starting from 1.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scope {Object} The scope of the handler
@param.description: The scope of the handler

@param.name: @param
@param.body: button {String} The text entry represents a button and its title
@param.description: The text entry represents a button and its title

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Displays a warning dialog. When the application is running in an PhoneGap

@param.description: The title of the warning dialog.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: text {String} The text to display in the warning dialog.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: handler {Function} The handler to call when the OK button was pressed. The first parameter of the function is the index of the pressed button, starting from 1.
@param.description: The handler to call when the OK button was pressed. The first parameter of the function is the index of the pressed button, starting from 1.

@param.name: @param

@param.description: The scope of the handler

@param.description: The title of the waiting dialog.

@param.description: The text to display in the waiting dialog.

@param.description: The handler to call when the OK button was pressed. The first parameter of the function is the index of the pressed button, starting from 1.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scope {Object} The scope of the handler

@param.name: @param

buttons {String[]} Each text entry of the array represents a button and

@param.description:
Each text entry of the array represents a button and
its title

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Processes the dialog buttons. Converts them to PhoneGap compatible strings.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
buttons {String[]} Each text entry of the array represents a button and
its title
@param.description:
Each text entry of the array represents a button and
its title

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} The concatenated, PhoneGap compatible, button string
@return.description: The concatenated, PhoneGap compatible, button string

@param.name: @param
@param.body: title {String} The title of the dialog.
@param.description: The title of the dialog.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: text {String} The text to display in the dialog.
@param.description: The text to display in the dialog.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: handler {Function} The handler to call when the OK button was pressed. The first parameter of the function is the index of the pressed button, starting from 1.
@param.description: The handler to call when the OK button was pressed. The first parameter of the function is the index of the pressed button, starting from 1.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scope {Object} The scope of the handler
@param.description: The scope of the handler

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
buttons {String[]} Each text entry of the array represents a button and
its title
@param.description:
Each text entry of the array represents a button and
its title

@param.name: @param
@param.body: dialogType {Integer} One of the static dialog types.
@param.description: One of the static dialog types.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.
